content:
This article is about the boss variant of hydras. For the normal Slayer monster, see Hydra.
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This article has a money making guide: Killing the Alchemical Hydra.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.
This article has a Slayer task guide here.
Information comparing locations for Slayer tasks will be on this page
This fight takes place in an instanced area.
On death you can pay Orrvor quo Maten to retrieve any lost items. You will be charged 100,000 for this service. Should you die an unsafe death a second time before retrieving all your items, they will be lost completely.

The Alchemical Hydra is a boss found in the lower level of the Karuulm Slayer Dungeon in Mount Karuulm, requiring level 95 Slayer to kill. The Alchemical Hydra was the creation of a Dragonkin named Karuulm. While Karuulm saw promise in his creation, he nevertheless saw it as a failure because he could not replicate its traits, and abandoned it along with his other creations: the Wyrms, Drakes, and Hydras.

Unlike normal hydras, the Alchemical Hydra can only be killed while on a hydra Slayer task, which are only assigned by Konar. In addition, as it is only found within the volcano, players who have not completed the elite Kourend & Kebos Diary must wear boots of stone, boots of brimstone, or granite boots to protect themselves from the extreme heat of the dungeon floor.

Players should be wary about running back to collect items after death, and make sure to bring protection against the hot floor. The damage from the floor will interrupt attempts to reclaim items, making it impossible to do so, and dying a second time will wipe the death storage.

Along with all the unique drops obtainable from hydras, it can also drop hydra leather, which is used on the machinery south-west of the pool in the Lithkren Vault to create ferocious gloves, as well as the hydra claw, which is combined with a Zamorakian hasta to create the dragon hunter lance.

Alchemical Attack!
The music which plays when fighting the Alchemical Hydra

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
Karuulm Slayer Dungeon (Lower Level)4261Maplink

The boss's lair[edit | edit source]

To reach the boss, players must run north past the Tasakaal, then east past the hydras. They will then reach the entrance to the lair by Orrvor quo Maten. Alternatively, players with level 88 Agility can reach it safely by using the mysterious pipe just behind Kaal-Ket-Jor, though this takes roughly the same time as reaching it by running past the hydras.

Fight overview[edit | edit source]

Main article: Alchemical Hydra/Strategies

Alchemical Hydra has four phases throughout the fight, depending on its remaining health. It attacks with Ranged and Magic, alternating between them every three attacks for the first three phases. At the start of each phase, it has a 75% damage reduction, which can be removed if it is lured over a vent on the floor which spews chemical liquid. However, the vent must be the correct one, corresponding to the combat triangle (e.g. when it is green, red will weaken it), otherwise the Hydra's damage is increased by up to 50%.

When the Alchemical Hydra reaches 75%, 50% or 25% of its health (that is, at 825, 550, and 275 Hitpoints), it will lose one of its heads and change phase. The damage reduction is reapplied, and so it should be lured over the next vent. It also has special attacks for each phase: poison pools when green and black, electricity when blue and fire when red. These special attacks can be avoided, but they can be devastating if dealt with carelessly.

When the Hydra is killed, it will respawn in approximately 25 seconds.

Drops[edit | edit source]

In addition to the 100% drop, the player will also have two rolls on the Alchemical Hydra's drop table. The first drop has a chance to be a unique, while the second is always standard. The drop rates in the drop table below reflect the chance of getting an item for every roll on the standard loot table. For example, a listed drop rate of 2/100 indicates that you have two 2/100 chances of receiving that item.[1]

Drops remain on the ground for 30 minutes, or until the player leaves the instanced area.

Drop rates estimated based on 292,738 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Alchemical Hydra kill while on a Konar task is worth 185,751.05.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Alchemical Hydra.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Alchemical Veteran Kill the Alchemical Hydra 75 times. Elite Kill count
Alchemical Master Kill the Alchemical Hydra 150 times. Master Kill count
Unrequired Antipoisons Kill the Alchemical Hydra without being hit by the acid pool attack. Master Mechanical
Lightning Lure Kill the Alchemical Hydra without being hit by the lightning attack. Master Mechanical
Don't Flame Me Kill the Alchemical Hydra without being hit by the flame wall attack. Master Mechanical
Mixing Correctly Kill the Alchemical Hydra without empowering it. Master Mechanical
The Flame Skipper Kill the Alchemical Hydra without letting it spawn a flame wall attack. Master Mechanical
Alcleanical Hydra Kill the Alchemical Hydra without taking any damage. Master Perfection
Alchemical Speed-Chaser Kill the Alchemical Hydra in less than 1 minute 45 seconds. Master Speed
Working Overtime Kill the Alchemical Hydra 15 times without leaving the room. Master Stamina
No Pressure Kill the Alchemical Hydra using only Dharok's Greataxe as a weapon whilst having no more than 10 Hitpoints throughout the entire fight. Grandmaster Restriction
Alchemical Speed-Runner Kill the Alchemical Hydra in less than 1 minute 20 seconds. Grandmaster Speed

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 March 2022
(update)

Certain Combat Achievement tasks now perform their checks correctly in the final phase of the Alchemical Hydra fight.

26 August 2021
(update)

Alchemical Hydra's animation issues have been fixed.

14 July 2021
(update | poll)

The Alchemical Hydra now has an animation to indicate it changing attack styles.

13 June 2019
(update)

Players can no longer logout in the Alchemical Hydra room due to an issue where players trying to log out in the room kept getting stuck in a state where they couldn't attack the boss but it kept trying to attack them.

7 February 2019
(update | poll)

The alchemical hydra heads were added as a possible tertiary drop.

31 January 2019
(update)

The jar of chemicals was added as a possible tertiary drop.

14 January 2019
(update) 		Hotfix

The Alchemical Hydra gained access to Konar's drop table.[4]
